article: The market for children's products in China will double within the next five years, a report made public at a kids expo in east China's Zhejiang Province has predicted.  The market _ for children's products in China was more than 1 trillion yuan (152 billion U. S. dollars) in 2010 and that _ is expected to hit 2 trillion yuan by 2015, according to the report. The report said that the _ growth of the business had a lot to do with the country's large population, steady consumption and _ attention to child health and education in recent years. It is _ that China has a population of about 200 million _ under the age of 10 according to the report. A Chinese family will spend an _ of 5,000 yuan (758 dollars) per child each year, according to a _ by the Hangzhou Association of Industries on Children. This money goes to a variety of companies _ child products and _ such as baby milk powder, clothing, toys, education and entertainment. According to a report by the China E-commerce Research Center, online shopping of baby milk powder from overseas companies _ reached 2.4 billion yuan in 2010. 32 _ is another area that has _ investors at home and abroad. Twelve Chinese educational institutions have won _ support from overseas investors, with _ totaling 100 million dollars so far.
